overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a thorough, methodical approach to time-series forecasting with a focus on handling anomalies and seasonality. The analyst identifies daily patterns, addresses data quality issues (missing values and anomalies), and develops a tailored solution using simple averaging with seasonal indices. The process is highly detailed, involving data inspection, pattern analysis, and step-by-step computation of seasonal components while navigating constraints like the inability to run actual models.
common_data_patterns: Anomalies/missing values (sudden drop followed by constant values)
Data quality issues requiring exclusion of anomalous periods
key_insights: Exclusion of anomalous data segments to preserve pattern integrity
Use of partial-cycle data to compute seasonal indices (hours 0-18 from 3 days, hours 19-23 from 2 days)
Base-level calculation using the last 24-hour normal cycle for forecast anchoring
Realignment of seasonal cycles to match forecasting windows (00:00-23:00)
Normalization of seasonal indices relative to cycle averages
complexity_analysis: Highly detailed with multi-step analysis: combines data diagnostics, anomaly handling, seasonal decomposition, manual index computation, and level adjustments under operational constraints.
